qas.question: When B cells and T cells begin to replicate, what do some of their offspring cells become?
The function of long-lived memory cells is an example of what kind of immune response?
Immunological memory can take what two forms?

answers.text: passive short-term memory or active long-term memory
passive short-term memory or active long-term memory
passive short-term memory or active long-term memory

qas.question: Long-lived memory cells can remember previous encounters with what?

plausible_answers.text: some of their offspring become long-lived memory cells

qas.question: What happens when B cells and T cells are deactivated?
What cells mount a weak response if a pathogen is detected again?
What is not a form of immunological memory?

plausible_answers.text: prepares the immune system for future challenges

qas.question: Why are memory cells not considered adaptive?
What cells are unable to remember specific pathogens?
